intro: Carpophora viscosa, commonly known as the sticky carpophora, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its viscid (sticky) leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
